description:
Takifugu bimaculatus, also known as the two-spot puffer or two-spot pufferfish, is a species of pufferfish belonging to the family Tetraodontidae. It is native to the coastal waters of East Asia, primarily found in the waters of Japan, South Korea, and China.

The Takifugu bimaculatus is a small to medium-sized pufferfish, typically reaching a maximum length of around 20 centimeters (8 inches). It is characterized by its rounded, globular body and the presence of two distinct dark spots on its back, which give it its common name. Like other pufferfish, it has the ability to inflate its body as a defense mechanism when threatened.

This species is known to inhabit shallow coastal environments, such as coral reefs, rocky areas, and seagrass beds, where it feeds primarily on small invertebrates and algae. Takifugu bimaculatus is considered a delicacy in some Asian cuisines, and it is also kept as an ornamental fish in the aquarium trade.

Due to its limited distribution and potential overfishing, the conservation status of Takifugu bimaculatus is a topic of ongoing research and monitoring by various conservation organizations.
